findings.title: TUU - Time Units Usage
findings.description: The contract is using arbitrary numbers to form time-related values, decreasing readability and preventing compiler optimization.

findings.title: WAV - Withdraw Amount Validation
findings.description: The contract is missing withdraw amount validation in the `withdraw` function. The absence of validation may lead to revert of the method.

findings.title: EUU - Ether Units Usage
findings.description: The contract is using arbitrary numbers to form ether-related values, decreasing readability and preventing compiler optimization.

findings.title: MSC - Missing Sanity Check
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape.

findings.title: TAP - Transfer Amount Prevalidation
findings.description: The current implementation of the contract does not prevalidate whether sufficient tokens are available to perform transactions, which can lead to transaction failures or unexpected behavior.

findings.title: RSSF - Redundant Staking Status Functionality
findings.description: The contract is utilizing the `staking.status` variable which is redundant and can be optimized by reusing existing variables to determine if a staking element exists.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, which can improve readability and maintainability. Non-conformance to these guidelines may lead to decreased code quality.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The contract does not lock the pragma version, which may lead to unexpected versions being used during deployment, potentially introducing vulnerabilities and undiscovered bugs.
